comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content:
Possibly a Gentleman Cadet Frederic Ernest Welch (sometimes also shown as Ernest Frederic Welch) who was commissioned from the Royal Military College on 5th August 1905 into the Royal Artillery in preparation for posting to join a Gunner regiment in India. [LG 5377 dated 4th August 1905]?

An outside chance, there is also a Lieutenant Walter George Frederic Welch (b. 7 March 1890), of 117th Battery in 26th Brigade RFA, listed as killed in action on 30th October 1914.  Aged 24, commissioned in 1910, son of Reginald Courtenay Welch, 1851-1939, (England and Wanderers footballer, winners of the first FA Cup finals in 1872 and 73), Principal of the Army College, Heath End, Farnham, Surrey.  W G F Welch was at Charterhouse (Verites House) 1904-05//

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: This portrait photograph was taken at the studio of, if not actually by, Henry Walter Barnett, (1862-1934), the famous society photographer. An Australian by birth, Walter Barnett's studio was at Hyde Park and he was both a member of the Royal Photographic Society of Great Britain and a founder member of the Professional Photographers' Association. That Walter Barnett photographed the Royal family suggests that his work was at the very top of his profession at the time. He also took the photograph of Corporal of Horse Oakley RHG, elsewhere in this IWM portfolio. A picture of Walter Barnett is at adb.anu.edu.au/biography/barnett-henry-walter-5139 .//

comment.author: 32300107@N06
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/69679868@N03] Great information about the photographer - thank you Gary.

comment.author: 65872721@N02
comment._content: this seems likely to be Frederick Londown(?) Welch who joined the HAC (artillery) and served in France from 1917, and was later commissioned as a temporary 2nd Lt - 21st October 1918, one of the last batch of wartime commissions in RH & RFA. (per Dec 1918 Army List)

comment.author: 65872721@N02
comment._content: The London Gazette 9 Nov 1918 (13260) lists him as Frederick Loudoun Welch. This name appears to be correct (born Hendon 1895 - d. 1952)

comment.author: 69679868@N03
comment._content: Well done 'oldnubia' - I think your man, Frederick Loudon Welch, is most likely to be the man in the photograph.//
